isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - REMOVE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

caution.para: Be careful when removing the mainshaft assembly as the sliding clutch on the end can slip off the mainshaft. Reverse gear is also free and can fall off the shaft.

step1.para: Remove the reverse gear retaining snap ring from the mainshaft ( Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Remove Reverse Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Move the mainshaft reverse gear as far to the rear as possible and remove reverse gear I.D. snap ring.
Move the reverse gear forward and against the next gear, engaging the mainshaft sliding clutch spline ( Figure 51).

svcproc.para:
If not removing the upper reverse idler gear assembly, you must remove the upper reverse idler gear assembly shaft and roll the gear to the outside. Refer to REMOVE, REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY, Steps 1-4
.

step1.para: Use a large screwdriver to block the upper countershaft assembly against the case wall ( Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Block Upper Countershaft Assembly Against Case Wall

svcproc.para: If removing the upper reverse idler gear assembly, refer to REMOVE, REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY at this time.

step1.para: Position a hook or rope around the mainshaft ( Figure 52).
Pull the mainshaft to the rear to free the pilot from the input shaft pocket ( Figure 52).

important.para: The upper countershaft must be kept forward against the case front wall. After mainshaft is free of the pilot, move it as far forward as possible.

step1.para: Tilt mainshaft front up and lift assembly from the case ( Figure 53).
